overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a structured approach to time-series forecasting with limited data, starting with model consideration (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing) but shifting to heuristic methods due to simulation constraints. It emphasizes identifying patterns, handling potential missing values, and adapting to data limitations. The final method uses simple averaging technique based on recent data, balancing sophistication with practicality given the small dataset.
common_data_patterns: Intra-day pattern (higher daytime values, lower nighttime values)
key_insights: Prioritizing recent data patterns (last 2 days) for forecasting when historical data is limited
Using daily/hourly averaging to capture seasonality when advanced modeling isn't feasible
Checking for and addressing missing values as a preliminary step
Balancing trend projection with pattern stabilization observations
Adjusting forecasts based on daily average shifts to maintain consistency
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with multi-step heuristic analysis: Combines statistical concepts (seasonality, trend decomposition) with practical simplifications. Includes data inspection, pattern quantification, and iterative method adaptation, but avoids computational modeling due to constraints.
